FunctionLayer

Class Bricks

  • java.lang.Object
    • FunctionLayer.Bricks

  • public class Bricks
extends Object
    The purpose of Bricks is to store information about how many bricks is needed to build a certain Lego house and if this house has holes for a door and a window.
    Author:
    Gert Lehmann Madsen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bricks() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBricks(int four, int two, int one)
      This method sums the amount of bricks needed for a layer of the lego house to the previous calculated layers.
      void addDoorAndWindow()
      This methods is used when holes for a door and a window is applied to the house.
      int getFour() 
      int getOne() 
      int getTwo() 
      boolean isHoles()

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • getFour

      • getTwo

        public int getTwo()

      • getOne

        public int getOne()

      • isHoles

        public boolean isHoles()

      • addBricks

        public void addBricks(int four,
                      int two,
                      int one)
        This method sums the amount of bricks needed for a layer of the lego house to the previous calculated layers.
        Parameters:
        four - numbers of 4x2 bricks
        two - numbers of 2x2 bricks
        one - numbers of 2x1 bricks

      • addDoorAndWindow

        public void addDoorAndWindow()
        This methods is used when holes for a door and a window is applied to the house. A door hole substitute nine 4x2 bricks with six 2x2 bricks and a window substitute six 4x2 bricks with four 2x2 bricks.
